sentences.en: By a quirk of fate they have booked into the same hotel.
sentences.cn: 由于命运的捉弄,他们住进同一家旅馆.

sentences.en: By a strange quirk of fate they had booked into the same hotel.
sentences.cn: 真是天缘奇遇，他们住进了同一家旅馆。

sentences.en: By some quirk of fate the two of us were on the same train.
sentences.cn: 出于命运安排,我们两人乘上了同一列火车.

sentences.en: By some quirk of fate the two of us where on the same train.
sentences.cn: 由于命运的巧妙安排,我们俩乘上了同一列火车.

sentences.en: I developed a bath to come out to sweating all the time today, quirk?
sentences.cn: 今天我冲了个澡出来就一直在冒汗, 怪事啦?

sentences.en: I think it's a quirk of personality Abdul - Jabbar.
sentences.cn: 我觉得这是个人的一种怪癖.

sentences.en: It can be regarded as merely a mathematical quirk of the theory of weak interactions.
sentences.cn: 这可被看成仅仅是弱相互作用理论的一种数学上的技巧.

sentences.en: Like every computer, this one has its little quirks.
sentences.cn: 就像所有电脑一样，这台也有它的小毛病。

sentences.en: Others among us , myself included, thought it just an odd quirk.
sentences.cn: 包括我在内的其他人则认为这只是一种怪癖.

sentences.en: The spate of storms and hurricanes in recent years could be a statistical quirk.
sentences.cn: 从统计数字上看，近些年来暴风雨和飓风的频发非同寻常。

sentences.en: What do you think is 6's biggest unknown ( hidden ? ) quirk ( weird habit ) ?
sentences.cn: 你认为6最大的不为人知的 怪癖 是 什么 ?

trans.tran_cn: 奇事，巧合，怪癖，突然的弯曲
trans.tran_en: a strange habit or feature of someone’s character, or a strange feature of something
